Elon Musk kommentiert ein Posting bei X mit einem "Drüberkommentar", bei dem es um ihn selber geht.

Der Kommentar ist von DogeDesigner. Unter dem Spruch "Grokipedia is coming ..." sieht man eine Karrikatur, in der Elon Musk als Sensenmann bereits zwei Räume betreten hat mit den Aufschriften CNN bzw. Facebook/Instagram/TikTok/..., aus denen Blut herausläuft. Nun klopft er als Tod bei Wikipedia an.

Musks Drüberkommentar:
"Join 
@xAI
 and help build Grokipedia, an open source knowledge repository that is vastly better than Wikipedia!

This will be available to the public with no limits on use." Gepostet von vor 9 Stunden, 17 Mio mal angezeigt.

record.bridgyOriginalText: Vibe coding with ChatGPT. It had a nice idea of solving a problem by just reading aio control blocks out of a programs user space to reverse engineer what it was doing. We will timestamp things and log the aio_read() file names and importantly the target malloc’ed memory they are being read into which tells me what I want to know… all that and it’s taken as much effort to first get ChatGPT to give me Makefiles vs one line compile instructions… then took multiple goes to stop it repeating the unchanged Makefile on every frigging step. I think my vibe code partner is drunk.

record.text:
• nutzt KI für möglichst viele Aufgaben, die sonst zeitaufwendig wären (Texte lesen, Hausarbeiten, etc.). Hier gilt: Zeit ist Geld und work smarter not harder.
• Nachahmung ist die beste Form der Schmeichelei. Wenn ihr irgendwo was Gutes lest, kopiert das am besten in eure eigenen Texte.

• Ersti-WhatsApp-Gruppen sind ein Ort der Vernetzung und Kreativität, gerade wenn ihr selbst gerne Memes bastelt oder viele gute GIFs kennt, schickt die immer für einen guten Lacher in Diskussionen in die Gruppe
• ChatGPT kann euch eine Abgabe in 30 Sekunden schreiben und alle Paper für euch lesen

• grundsätzlich gilt, dass es in Unis draußen immer zu kalt oder zu warm ist. Daher könnt ihr ruhig lautstark dagegen protestieren, wenn jemand in Seminarräumen ein Fenster öffnet. Es soll sich ja niemand erkälten.
• Profis verstecken die wichtigen Bücher in der Bib in einem anderen Regal

Heute sind neuronale Netzwerke die Grundlage all dessen, was populär als KI gehandelt wird. Richard Socher hat das Prompt Engineering erfunden, also die Eingabe von frei formulierten Sätzen, die heute Standard ist bei der Bedienung von Systemen wie ChatGPT.

Seine Antwort ist übrigens deutlich: Ja.

Seine Veröffentlichungen haben die Entwicklung der Large Language Models wie ChatGPT stark beeinflusst. Seine Dissertation aus dem Jahr 2016 führte rekursive neuronale Netzwerke für die Sprach- und Bildverarbeitung ein – zu einer Zeit, als neuronale Netzwerke als Sackgasse galten.

Nun also "Können Maschinen denken?" Ist ChatGPT nur ein schlichtes Programm – oder kann es wirklich über die Dinge reflektieren? Darüber habe ich mit Richard Socher gesprochen, einem der meistzitierten KI-Forscher der neuen Generation, ich habe ihn schon öfter interviewt.

record.text: Seit Jahren wird die Klima-Debatte von gezielter Desinformation und Propaganda geprägt - kann man hier noch gegensteuern? Dazu diskutiere ich bei der klimaaktiv Konferenz 2025 u.a mit @tamarasill.bsky.social und @johannaroniger.bsky.social von @kontext-institut.at: www.klimaaktiv.at/klimaaktiv-k...

images.alt:
klimaaktiv Konferenz 2025, 06.10.2025

13.00 Uhr Parallel-Session: Desinformation kostet, Lösungen überzeugen: Wie gute Kommunikation den Unterschied macht

Hitzewellen, Trockenheit, Starkregen – der Klimawandel ist längst Teil unseres Alltags. Der aktuelle APCC-Klimasachstandsbericht 2025 zeigt eindrücklich, wie tiefgreifend sich Österreich bereits durch den Klimawandel verändert hat – und was uns droht, wenn wir nicht entschlossen handeln. Die öffentliche Debatte wird allerdings zunehmend von gezielter Desinformation, Verunsicherung und Polarisierung geprägt. In dieser Panelsession diskutieren Expert:innen aus Wissenschaft und Medien, wie wirkungsvolle Kommunikation Vertrauen stärkt, irreführende Narrative entlarvt und konkrete Lösungen ins Zentrum rückt. Es diskutieren:

Luis Paulitsch, Datumstiftung für Journalismus und Demokratie
Johanna Roninger, Kontext Institut
Tamara Sill, ORF
(tba), Windkraft Simonsfeld

Das Publikum ist eingeladen, sich aktiv einzubringen – mit Fragen, Erfahrungen und Ideen. 

Brigitte Grahsl, Hannes Höller (Österreichische Energieagentur)

record.bridgyOriginalText:
@SmartmanApps thank you!

I finally got up for real and tried those examples myself. Except for the short equation, ChatGPT and GPT OSS 120B got everything right.

Reasoning models together with outsourcing to symbolic maths machines certainly helps a lot in that regard.

We both know that this is beside the point: School is not primarily about performance (although teachers and students alike tend to forget this), but about learning to learn. For this, we have to try.

So, which is greater, 9.11 or 9.9? At first, we don't know. Then we learn to reason. Later, we see this at a glance. Because we learned and exercised. The argument holds true for higher levels and different disciplines.

The point, and there is already research on this, I am trying to make, is that we risk losing the ability to really dive into hard problems, if we appreciate students who hand in "excellent" homework generated by LLMs.

external.title: Original post on fediscience.org

record.text: Het nieuws van 08:00 in het kort #nieuws #update

images.alt:
Nieuws van 08:00 in het kort:
In Ridderkerk woedde een hevige brand in partycentrum De Theetuin met restaurant en bowlingbaan. Er waren explosies, het vuur laaide opnieuw op en verspreidde veel rook. Enkele huizen werden preventief ontruimd; bewoners kregen advies ramen en deuren gesloten te houden.

De aardbeving van 6,9 op Cebu (Filipijnen) eist 69 levens, ruim 150 gewonden en laat tientallen vermisten achter. Het ziekenhuis is overbelast, infrastructuur is beschadigd en naschokken volgen. Hulp wordt verleend, maar regen en aardverschuivingen bemoeilijken de inzet.

Tientallen mensen zijn nog vermist na de beving. Vooral arme, heuvelachtige gebieden met niet-aardbevingsbestendige woningen zijn zwaar getroffen. De viceburgemeester van San Remigio vraagt om voedsel, water en noodartikelen voor evacués.

De Amerikaanse overheid is tijdelijk gesloten vanwege een begrotingsconflict tussen Democraten en Republikeinen. Beide partijen geven elkaar de schuld, met name over financiering van grensbeveiliging en sociale programma’s.

Vanaf volgend jaar stijgt de motorrijtuigbelasting in Zuid-Holland. De provincie bevestigt hogere kosten voor automobilisten in de regio als onderdeel van de nieuwe begroting.

record.text: Het nieuws van 07:30 in het kort #nieuws #update

images.alt:
Nieuws van 07:30 in het kort:
Met vier weken tot de verkiezingen helpen online stemhulpen zoals **Stemwijzer** en **Kieskompas** kiezers bij hun keuze. Beide tools vergelijken standpunten uit verkiezingsprogramma’s, terwijl de **Stemchecker** kijkt naar eerdere Kamerstandpunten. In 2023 werden ze samen 12 miljoen keer ingevuld, vaak om bestaande voorkeuren te toetsen.

Het ontwikkelen van deze hulpen is intensief: partijen onderhandelen over stellingen, waarbij een kwart discussie oproept. Critici wijzen op de nadruk op verschillen tussen partijen, terwijl democratie juist om compromissen draait. Ook ontbreekt inzicht in financiële keuzes, doordat CPB-doorrekeningen pas laat beschikbaar zijn.

**ChatGPT** als stemhulp is onbetrouwbaar door fouten en gebrek aan neutraliteit, al kan het wel programma’s samenvatten. Stemhulpen spelen vooral een **ondersteunende rol**, aangezien kiezersvoorkeuren vaak verschuiven – zoals bij FVD, BBB en PVV de afgelopen jaren.

OpenAI's Sora App Creates Realistic AI Videos of You and Your Friends

OpenAI has launched Sora, an invite-only AI video app and social network.  This platform allows users to create realistic AI videos featuring themselves and others.  Sora utilizes the advanced Sora 2 video ge…

#gpt #openai #sora

external.description: OpenAI has launched Sora, an invite-only AI video app and social network.  This platform allows users to create realistic AI videos featuring themselves and others.  Sora utilizes the advanced Sora 2 video generation model, which boasts improved physical accuracy, realism, and control. The model is capable of generating complex movements that adhere to the laws of physics and excels in cinematic and anime styles.  Notably, Sora 2 can now generate video with integrated audio, including speech, soundscapes, and sound effects.  A key feature is the ability to insert users into generated environments while maintaining their appearance and voice.  The Sora app lets users create videos of themselves for "cameos," which are short clips shared on the social network. Users can grant permission for others to use their likeness in cameos and control who can use them.  The app also provides a feed based on followed users and includes regular wellbeing checks, with controls to modify content. Sora is designed for use with friends, hence its invite-only nature. The Sora app is available on iOS in the US and Canada, while invited users can access Sora 2 via the Sora website. Sora 2 is currently free, with ChatGPT Pro users gaining access to Sora 2 Pro.
external.title: OpenAI's Sora App Creates Realistic AI Videos of You and Your Friends

images.alt:
Blue Lard (Russian: Голубое сало, romanized: Goluboye salo) is a postmodern novel by Russian writer Vladimir Sorokin. It was first published in 1999 by Ad Marginem.
Plot
The plot of the book revolves around a substance called "blue lard" that the clones of Russian writers produce when they write[1] which is then used to power a hidden reactor on the moon.[2] Some of the cloned Russian writers include Tolstoy, Dostoyevsky, Akhmatova, Chekhov and Nabokov.[2] The novel takes place in two timelines: the second half of the 21st century (set in Siberia and Moscow in the future) and an alternative timeline of 1954 (in Joseph Stalin's Moscow and Adolf Hitler's Third Reich).

external.description:
記録的短時間大雨情報が出された宮城県では、道路が冠水するなどの被害が出ています。

　仙台市宮城野区付近では、1日午前11時30分までの1時間におよそ100ミリの猛烈な雨が降ったとみられ、気象庁は記録的短時間大雨情報を発表しました。

　また、隣の塩釜市でも正午までの3時間に100ミリを超える雨を観測していて、道路が冠水し、車が水没するなどの被害が出ています。

　宮城県では2日明け方にかけて雷を伴った激しい雨が降る可能性があり、低い土地の浸水や河川の増水などに警戒が必要です。
external.title: 【速報】宮城県に記録的短時間大雨情報　道路が冠水し車水没

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The DOPAMINE Menu: A 5-Minute BRAIN HACK to End Procrastination" on @Spreaker #adhd #adhdhacks #brainhack #dopamine #executivedysfunction #flowstate #focus #getorganized #habits #lifehacks #mentalhealth #mindfulness #motivation #neurodivergent #neurospicy #procrastination

external.description:
Do you ever stare at a simple task—like answering an email or doing the dishes—and feel a physical inability to start? It’s not laziness; it’s a dopamine deficit. Your brain is literally refusing to work for free.

But what if you could turn your to-do list into a game you actually want to play?

In today's episode, we're building the single most powerful tool for overcoming executive dysfunction: The Dopamine Menu. This isn't just another productivity trick; it's a personalized system for rewarding your brain and creating motivation on demand.

You'll learn:

- The simple science behind why your brain craves dopamine to get things done.
- A step-by-step guide to creating your own Dopamine Menu in under 5 minutes, using just your phone.
- How to categorize your "rewards" into 'Appetizers,' 'Main Courses,' and 'Desserts' to match the energy of your tasks.
- Practical ways to use your new menu to conquer laundry, paperwork, and any other "boring" task that’s been haunting you.


This one concept can fundamentally change your relationship with work and chores. Stop fighting your brain and start feeding it what it needs to succeed.
Let's build your menu.
external.title: The DOPAMINE Menu: A 5-Minute BRAIN HACK to End Procrastination

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "How to DEFEAT Workplace STRESS in 10 Seconds" on @Spreaker #angermanagement #calmunderpressure #careeradvice #careergrowth #conflictresolution #corporatelife #emotionalintelligence #emotionalregulation #emotionalresilience #leadershipskills #mentalhealthatwork #mindset

external.description:
Are you one passive-aggressive email away from a career-ending meltdown? You’re not alone. That feeling of hot rage bubbling up over a minor workplace irritation isn't a character flaw—it's your ancient brain running a fight-or-flight program in a modern office. And "just take a deep breath" is the worst advice you'll ever get.

Forget everything you think you know about anger management. This isn't about suppressing frustration; it's about transforming it into your greatest professional asset. In this episode, we unpack the psychology of workplace anger and give you a powerful, three-step framework for mastering your emotional intelligence that actually works under pressure.

We'll reveal how to become an observer of your own triggers, deploy the strategic "pause" to switch from your primal lizard brain to your rational prefrontal cortex, and reframe tense situations to gain strategic insight instead of losing your cool. This is the ultimate guide to emotional regulation for ambitious professionals. We'll also cover why setting boundaries at work and getting enough sleep are non-negotiable for building long-term emotional resilience.

Mastering this isn't just about stress management; it's about becoming the calm, influential leader in any room. It's time to stop being controlled by your emotions and start using them to fuel your career growth.

If this resonates with you, do yourself and your team a favor: hit subscribe and share this episode with a colleague who needs this today. Let's make composure the new superpower in the office.
external.title: How to DEFEAT Workplace STRESS in 10 Seconds

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Is Elon Musk's NEURALINK the Next Step in EVOLUTION or a Body HORROR Nightmare?" on @Spreaker #ai #biohacking #bodyhorror #braincomputerinterface #brainjacking #cyberpunk #digitalconsciousness #elonmusk #ethics #existentialrisk #futureofhumanity #futuretech #neuralink

external.description:
Elon Musk wants to put a computer in your brain. Should you let him? He's selling a utopia of cured diseases and human-AI symbiosis. But what if the next step in evolution is a body horror nightmare waiting to happen?

Welcome to the definitive debate on Neuralink. This is not science fiction anymore. We're peeling back the layers of hype and "neuro-enchantment" to expose the terrifying ethical, social, and legal questions that big tech doesn't want to answer. We'll explore the activist world of biohacking, but then pivot to the urgent legal battle for "neurorights"—the fight to own your own thoughts in a world where they can be read, recorded, and maybe even rewritten.

We're diving deep into the darkest corners of Reddit and expert forums to discuss the real fears: "brainjacking," the monetization of your consciousness, and the terrifying possibility that your mind could become just another device to be hacked. This is a critical look at the neurotechnology that could redefine what it means to be human.

Are you ready to open Pandora's Box? This episode is your guide to the most important technological debate of our lifetime.

If this conversation just rewired your brain, subscribe and share this episode with anyone who needs to understand what's coming. Then, head to the comments and answer the big question: Would you get a Neuralink implant? Yes or no, and why?
external.title: Is Elon Musk's NEURALINK the Next Step in EVOLUTION or a Body HORROR Nightmare?

record.text: The 6502 decoder journey underscores that understanding fundamental constraints and creative problem-solving (like dithering) are timeless engineering skills. These lessons transcend specific hardware, offering valuable insights for all software development. #SoftwareEngineering 6/6

Hardware vs. Software: A key insight was the diminishing returns of hyper-optimizing software when modern, faster hardware can simply brute-force the problem. Deciding when to optimize code versus upgrading hardware is a constant debate. #HardwareVsSoftware 5/6

Optimization Trade-offs: The discussion highlighted that extreme software optimization, especially on older hardware, often comes at the cost of code readability and maintainability. Balancing performance gains with code clarity is a critical, ongoing challenge. #CodeOptimization 4/6

#DLV 845: Obwohl die Dateien gar nicht auf OneDrive abgelegt werden sollen, geben Excel, PowerPoint und Word immer diesen Speicherort vor. Wie sich dies ändern lässt oder sogar wieder der alte, vertraute Speichern-Dialog aktiviert werden kann, erklären Kai Schneider und Markus Hahner.

#DLV 844: In einer Excel-Arbeitsmappe lassen sich Kommentare für Dritte hinzufügen. Diese müssen dann informiert werden, Excel öffnen, den Kommentar lesen usw. Umständlich? Ja, denn über den Kommentar zu informieren und zu reagieren, geht auch einfacher, wie Markus Hahner & Kai Schneider wissen.

⭐【Workflow Connections】AI excels at linking tasks together, clearing mental clutter so you can focus on important work—even without coding skills, thanks to tools like Zapier or IFTTT.

⭐Training with multi-perspective thinking sharpens communication skills too. Making a client pitch? Assign AI personas like “conservative 50-year-old manager” and “trend-savvy new hire,” then ask how each would react. You’ll know exactly what resonates—or falls flat—before the meeting.

⭐This also supports long-term consistency. Writing a novel and feel stuck? Ask AI, “What plot twist could come next?” or “Write a scene that dives into the protagonist’s emotions.” It helps you push past slumps, like having a coach by your side.

record.text:
グリーズマン、Aマドリードで200ゴール達成！エスタディオ・メトロポリターノで5－1の圧勝 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
アトレチコ・マドリードは、9月30日のUEFAチャンピオンズリーグ（欧州CL）1次リーグ第2節でフランクフルトに5-1で勝利した。

この試合で、アントワーヌ・グリーズマンがクラブ公式戦通算200得点を達成した。

前半アディショナルタイムの46分、グリーズマンはフリアン・アルバレスからのパスをダイレクトで決め、ゴールを記録。その後、背番号「200」のユニフォームを手にして喜びを表現した。

グリーズマンは2014年からAマドリードに在籍し、バルセロナでの短期間を挟んで2度目の在籍となる。

試合後、シメオネ監督はグリーズマンの成長を称賛。小柄なウインガーとして加入し、今ではトップ下でプレーし、ワールドカップ優勝を果たしたことを振り返った。

また、後半22分にはジュリアーノ・シメオネとのワンツーからゴールに迫ったが、ハンドの判定でゴールは認められなかった。

グリーズマンは年齢を感じさせないプレーを続け、試合後はサポーターからの称賛を受けた。
external.title: グリーズマン、Aマドリードで200ゴール達成！エスタディオ・メトロポリターノで5－1の圧勝 - AIサッカーまとめ

record.text:
「Rソシエダードの低迷とその原因、監督交代と補強の遅れが影響か」 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description: Rソシエダードは今季、1勝2分け4敗で18位と、過去10年で最低の成績で第7節を終えている。新監督セルヒオ・フランシスコの下、チームは大きな変化を迎えたが、補強の遅れと選手選定の問題が響いている。特に、センターフォワードの補強ができなかったことが得点力不足を招き、低迷の要因となった。主力選手のスビメンディはアーセナルに売却され、補強が遅れたため、シーズン開幕前から苦戦が予測されていた。特に、移籍市場の最終日に補強が決まり、戦力不足が顕著に。ジョキン・アペリバイ会長が獲得を望んだカルロス・ソレールは移籍後にやっと明るい兆しを見せたものの、全体的なパフォーマンスは振るわない。守備のミス連発やセットプレーの弱さも問題で、今季は悪夢のようなスタートとなった。
external.title: 「Rソシエダードの低迷とその原因、監督交代と補強の遅れが影響か」 - AIサッカーまとめ

record.text:
アトレチコ・マドリードが圧倒的な5－1でフランクフルトを撃破、堂安律は無得点 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description: アトレチコ・マドリードがホームでフランクフルトに5－1で圧勝した。試合は前半から動き、開始早々の4分にマドリードが先制。さらに33分にはコーナーキックから追加点を挙げ、前半終了間際にグリーズマンがゴールを決めて3点のリードを得る。後半、フランクフルトが12分にブルカートのゴールで1点を返すも、マドリードの攻勢が続き、グリーズマンのゴールがノーゴール判定された後、シメオネが得点を重ねる。最終的にアルバレスが5点目を決め、5－1の大差で勝利。フランクフルトは初戦の大勝を受けて2戦目で大敗となった。
